The claim made by U: S. Rep. Michael McCaul that "80% of children born in developing countries die of cancer each year" was fact-checked.
The claim was found to be a misquote of: WHO) that only 20% of children with cancer in developing countries are cured.
McCaul: s spokeswoman cited the WHO's fact-sheet on childhood cancer as the source for the congressman's statement, but the statistic was applied incorrectly to all children born in developing countries, creating a new inaccurate statistic.
The WHO finding measured survival rates: not the percentage of all children born in different countries who die from cancer each year.
